error.bad_config: Request failed due to bad config: Check at [stationboard]({stationboard_url}) if your station names are valid
error.unknown: An unknown error was raised by python-opendata-transport

abort.bad_config: Request failed due to bad config: Check the [stationboard]({stationboard_url}) for valid stations.
abort.unknown: An unknown error was raised by python-opendata-transport

user.description:
Provide start and end station for your connection

Check the [stationboard]({stationboard_url}) for valid stations.
user.title: Swiss Public Transport

init.title: Connection polling rate
init.description: Take note that the Swiss Public Transport API endpoint has a rate limit of `1000` request per day. Therefore, if you want multiple config entries, you need to reduce the polling rate. Each config entry uses `960` requests per day on a polling rate of `90s`.

deprecated_yaml_import_issue_cannot_conn.title: The swiss public transport YAML configuration import cannot connect to server
deprecated_yaml_import_issue_cannot_conn.description:
Configuring swiss public transport using YAML is being removed but there was an connection error importing your YAML configuration.

Make sure your home assistant can reach the [opendata server]({opendata_url}). In case the server is down, try again later.

deprecated_yaml_import_issue_bad_config.title: The swiss public transport YAML configuration import request failed due to bad config
deprecated_yaml_import_issue_bad_config.description:
Configuring swiss public transport using YAML is being removed but there was bad config imported in your YAML configuration.

Check the [stationboard]({stationboard_url}) for valid stations.

deprecated_yaml_import_issue_unknown.title: The swiss public transport YAML configuration import failed with unknown error raised by python-opendata-transport
deprecated_yaml_import_issue_unknown.description:
Configuring swiss public transport using YAML is being removed but there was an unknown error importing your YAML configuration.

Check your configuration or have a look at the documentation of the integration.
